intro: Senecio erosus, commonly known as the silky blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-blue leaves with a woolly texture, and its flowers are typically pale blue to white in color. Senecio erosus is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
